inn1.comm: On target: Full in length, around that off stump and moves away, he has a flash and a miss.
beaten again. Quite a deja-vu there. In the zone outside off, the front foot moves very little, just a itsy bitsy tiny weeny step and he has a big go at it.
this one swings in and the bat comes outside the line but he manages to get a inside-edge on to the pad
full and outside off, another intended drive and he gets a outside edge through to third man
full pitched and Nafees places it to right of mid-off
corrects the length, on a good length and whizzing past the off stump, left alone
short of length, on the middle stump, tucked to square leg
rushing through the channel outside off stump, he shapes to poke before withdrawing his bat.
beaten. Another ambitious drive. The ball is moving around a touch. This one left Tamim who has a flash and a miss
bangs it in short of length ,climbs chest-high and Tamim is troubled by the extra bounce but manages to fend it away, albeit a little ungainly, to the off side
142 kmph delivery on the middle and leg, defended towards square leg
wide outside off stump and the umpire extends his arms. The batsman was going after that, though. It was so wide but he still went for that shot but couldn't reach it
closer to the off stump, left alone
length delivery outside off stump and Nafees shoulders arms
curves in off a length, around middle and off, Nafees pushes at it and gets a outside edge to wide third man
fuller, well outside off and Tamim has another airy fairy drive and a miss. He has beaten repeatedly today.
finally lets one go past him
and again. Steyn tried to tempt him again but Tamim, it seems, has had enough of getting beaten and shoulders arms again.
on a length, angling away and defended to the off side
banged in short but its down the leg side. Morkel is working up some pace here.
144.5 kmph delivery, lands on a good length and moves away, left alone by the batsman
ah.. front foot no ball and a free hit coming up.
wild swing and a miss. He backed to the leg side and tried to heave a short of length delivery over midwicket but couldn't make contact
beaten outside off stump. It lands on a length and cuts away, Nafees tries to drill it on the up but ...
Finally they connect with one. Full pitched and he moved well towards the line of the delivery and played a neat cover drive.
further outside off and he goes hard at another cover drive, the bat handle rotates in his hands and the ball rolls back to the bowler
outside the off stump  and another play and a miss. Hmm..
length delivery around the off stump and punched to mid-off

I have lost count of how many times Tamim has been beaten. Again here, the same flashy drive and the ball rushes past the outside edge. The feet doesn't go anywhere and he seems perennially late on the drive and in search of the delivery.
Trust me, he didn't get beaten this time. He shouldered arms.
short of length and he punches it to point
on a length, around the off stump line, tapped to the onside
closer to the off stump and shaping away, Nafees covers his off stump and lets it go through to the 'keeper.
Nafees does a Tamim. He flashes at a length delivery outside off and is beaten
too short and Nafees pulls it from outside off to deep midwicket region
he continues to struggle. This delivery straightened after landing on the middle stump line and rapped him high on the pad
Well... Tamim is beaten. Again. Short of length delivery angling away from him at pace and he tries to punch on the up.
it landed outside leg stump, moved in to strike the pad
this one landed on the middle and straightened, defended to the off side
edged over slips. Length delivery outside off stump and Nafees has another go and gets an edge and the ball flies over the slips.
short in length, slanting across Nafees who runs it down to third man.
on the pads, clipped to fine leg. Tamim will be on strike. This should get interesting. What would be his approach now?
bounces into the pad and rolls over to the leg side
he rotates the strike. Wise decision. On the leg and middle, he wristed it to the leg side for a single
full and swinging in to the legs, flicked away to long leg region and Steyn makes a fabulous stop running around from fine leg
lands on a length, around leg and middle, cuts in towards middle,Tamim is squared up a touch but adjusts to push it to cover point
Tamim breaks free with a square drive. It was a length delivery and he connects with his on-the-up drive. He has been trying that for 8 overs now
back to regular programming; beaten outside off
better, opens the bat-face and runs it down to third man
swiped to deep square leg! It was on the off stump line but he just slogged it across.
short in length, around the off stump, Nafees goes back and across and defends to the off side
gets a half stride forward and taps it to mid-off

Tamim's in disbelief but he has to walk... Pitches on a good length a shade outside the offstump, Tamim pokes his bat out and there's a sound before the ball reaches the keeper. De Villiers the rest appeal and umpire Nadir Shah is convinced. Replays show the ball clipping the pad on the way through.
overpitches on the pads and Nazimuddin flicks it away stylishly past square leg, Morne Morkel does well to slide at the boundary and cut it off
fullish in length and cutting in, he gets a good stride forward and defends
gets on the frontfoot again and defends to the offside
streaky, he shapes to drive square but gets a thick outside edge which rolls past the slips
bangs it in slightly short of a length and that hurries onto him as he tries to tuck it to the on side
beats him outside off with another skiddy delivery
shoulders arms outside the offstump, this one was wider
fuller in length off, he drives square but straight to point
holds the length back outside off, he gets back and defends
this one kicks on him outside the offstump, he uneasily manages to fend it off
slower ball, the offcutter, he turns his wrists and tucks it to the on side
opens the face of the bat and steers it wide of backward point
poor shot, gives a bit of room and tries to glide it down to third man, he misses
and nearly throws his wicket away again as he nearly chops it back onto his stumps, Nafees is frustrated with himself
gets forward and taps it to the offside
the ball clips the pads and lobs to the on side, they take a quick single
coming in from round the stumps, cramping him up but he opens the bat-face and guides to backward point where its fielded well by Gibbs

Nafees  is gone too. This one too came in from round the wicket and again Nafees was cramped up and tried to play it quite similarly to the previous delivery : opening the bat face and trying to steer but this one bounced more and took the edge
streaky edge to third man. On a length, around the off stump, a tentative poke results in couple of runs
Hit on the helmet. It was a short-of-length delivery and Ashraful went for his pull shot and top edged it to the helmet grill
oh ho! He tries to heave a full one over the bowler's head and misses it completely.
another swing and a miss. It was banged in short and he didn't connect with his pull and Boucher jumped but could only make a half-stop
picked over square leg. More risks. It was a slightly short in length, on the middle and leg and he short-arm jabbed it over the infield
shapes in from just outside off and he defends on the front foot
slightly slower in pace, outside off stump, tapped to left of third man
low full toss, Ashraful swings it to long leg
A elegant straight punchy drive. Full pitched, mind you, but he did put it away neatly.
full again, pushed away to the off side
full in length, in the zone outside off, left alone
They are counterattacking. The crowd is going wild. Slightly short in length, outside off stump and Ash pulls it through wide mid-on region.
down the leg side, Ash tries to play a pick-up stroke to fine leg but can't reach it
beaten on the flirt. In the channel, holding its line and Ashraful has a flirtatious poke.
leans forward this time, moves towards the line to defend a length delivery to point
edged to third man for a single. He stabbed a delivery outside off.

Dust to Ash es . Death by aggression. Full in length, on the middle stump and he goes for a ugly heave and can only manage to send it to mid-on. Ashraful is livid with himself. But the deed has been done. Just 17 runs in this series. What a waste of a talent.
full in length, around the off stump, defended to the off side
climbs up from short of length, dabbed to the off side
slower one and steered to point
fullish, driven well but Albie does well to stop it on the follow through
another slower one and is pushed down the track
shuffles across to the off side and nudges it to short fine leg
slips down the leg, the batsman can't reach it, the 'keeper does.
on the legs, turned to fine leg for a single
comes in from round the stumps and the left-hander Shakib defends down the track
short in length, outside off stump, pushed to cover point
on the pads, worked to long leg for couple of runs
beaten outside off. Short in length, rushing through the channel and Shakib tries to cut but can't connect.
There is a fine leg and deep square leg but he plays a pick-up shot in the air and right between them.
leans forward to drive to covers.
cutting in towards the pad, he tries to turn it around the corner but it runs off the pad to the 'keeper
slower one outside off, he waited on that before chopping it to right of third man. Very well adjusted by Nazimuddin.
offers width and is driven uppishly towards covers

OMG! What happened there? They are in a suicide mode here. He walked right across the stumps and tried to slog a length delivery across the line but only skied it for Smith to get under it at midwicket. Horrible shot. What was he thinking? Was he thinking?
leans forward to defend a delivery outside off stump
flighted delivery, driven to mid-off
almost cleaned him up. It turned in from outside off, he neither went forward or back, left a bat and pad gap and got a inside edge
comes down the track and drives back to the bowler
he leans forward to nudge a flighted delivery to short leg
plays a paddle sweep to fine leg
on the pads, tucked behind square for a single
banged in short and swayed away
fullish, on the leg and middle, flicked through midwicket
he keeps his bat raised in air as he waits for the bowler to release and this time got solidly in line to defend
he keeps his bat raised in air as he waits for the bowler to release and this time got solidly in line to defend
fuller, on the middle and leg, jabbed to the on side
leans forward to drive to mid-off
from round the stumps, outside off stump, punched to cover point
leans forward to drive to mid-off
skips down the track, reaches the pitch and lofts it between the bowler and mid-on
full and outside off, dabbed to right of backward point
edged past the diving slip. Almost caught. It turned away from him and he followed it by opening the bat face and but Smith couldn't reach the ball that was going to his left
on the legs, tickled past square leg
sweeps from well outside off towards long leg
tries to turn it to the on side, gets a edge down the track
leans forward to defend
spins down the leg side
tries to sweep and is rapped on the pad and it runs to point region
leans forward to defend
swept from outside off, to midwicket region
beaten outside off. It didn't spin in as much as he thought
turns in and defended to the leg side
spins in from outside off, goes back to work it to cover point
One more down. Shakib is cleaned up. Flighted from round the stumps, full, he tried to whip it to midwicket, missed and the ball bounded off the pad and on to the stumps.
goes back to defend to the on side
leans forward to drive to covers
loud appeal for lbw. Close. . It evaded the defensive stroke and hit him on the midde and leg. Perhaps the umpire felt it would have spun down leg.
leans forward to dab a delivery to left of backward point
goes back to turn a turning delivery to long leg
Dropped by Amla at short leg. Tough chance, though. He went back to turn to right of Amla who stretched his right hand out but couldn't hold on
goes back to punch it past point
full and driven uppishly towards mid-off
goes back to defend
gets forward this time and defend to the off side
and again. Harris is bowling from round the stumps
loud appeal for lbw but it struck him outside off. He tried to defend but was beaten by the armer
full and on the leg stump line, swept to fine leg
leans forward to drive to covers

The third umpire has given Raqibul run out. Dhiman went back and pushed towards covers, Duminy swooped in and fired in a throw to the 'keeper who took the bails off. There was a doubt whether the bails had come off before the batsman had dragged the bat inside the crease but on careful and repeated viewing, the umpire presses the red button.
leans forward to defend a turning delivery
spins down the leg side
goes back to defend a delivery that turns in
charges down the track and lofts over mid-off
flighted on a good length on off stump, defended on the off side
defended on the front foot on the leg side
tries to hit against the turn towards midwicket and misses
bowled him! Harris slips in the arm ball on middle and off, Ghosh moves back and tries to cut, he gets beaten for pace and misses, Bangladesh are seven down, an abject performance so far
Razzak tries to drive from off stump towards mid-on but gets an inside edge behind square
tossed up into the right-hander from round the wicket, Reza moves forward and blocks
bowled quicker through the air from round the wicket, the ball bounces around off stump and turns away from the left hander to beat the bat
Razzak tries to cut of the back foot but misses
defended on the front foot towards the off side
Botha bowls a back-foot no ball for cutting the return crease, Razak tries to hammer it down the ground but gets an inside edge to fine leg
Botha bowls a yorker which Reza digs back to the bowler, an excellent delivery to bowl on a free hit
beaten outside off, Trying to cut a delivery but it doesn't turn in enough
gets forward to dead-bat a spinning delivery
pushed back to the bowler
driven uppishly towards long-on
on the off stump line, nudged to the off side
on the middle and off, dabbed to the leg side
drops it short and is cut to deep point
swept to the leg side
turns away from the batsman who guides it to point

de Villiers messes up a simple run out chance. Peterson charged in from backward point to collect the ball and fired in an accurate throw to de Villiers who doesn't collect the ball cleanly and breaks the stumps with his gloves. But the ball dropped to the ground. Poor effort.
loopy delivery, pushed down the track
goes back to clip it to long leg
plants his front foot out and heaves it to deep midwicket boundary
Another swipe across the line and de Villiers takes a very sharp catch. Razzak top-edged a intended slog and de Villiers managed to hold on to a tough chance.
full and straight, defended on the front foot
he goes down town. He ran down the track and lofted it over mid-on
slows up the pace, goes back and is early with his shot- a punchy uppish drive past the diving Harris
leans forward to tap a full delivery to the on side
on the middle and leg, runs of the pad to short fine leg region
spins to the off stump, pushed to covers
turns to the pads and he doesn't offer a shot and the ball runs towards short fine leg. They cross over for a leg bye but the umpire says its a dead ball. You didn' play any shot
on the pads, turned around the corner for a single
leans forward to defend a flighted delivery outside off
on the off and middle, worked with the spin to midwicket
pushes it outside off and he runs it down to deep backward point
on the middle stump line, turned to short leg
on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot
fuller and driven back to Harris
on the middle and off, defended to the off side
opens the bat-face, guides to cover point and sets for a single but Mortaza is not interested and he scampers back home
on the leg and middle, worked to short midwicket
leans forward to dead bat a delivery on the middle and off

appeal for a catch behind. Full in length, just outside the off stump, tried to opend the bat-face and run it to third man. Was there a little nick? Hmm.. The bowler didn't appeal initially and only joined in after de Villiers appealed. It appears as if it went off the face of the bat.
outside the off stump and de Villiers gathers
short in length, in the zone outside off, Mortaza lets it go past him
short of length and steered to point
outside off again and Mortaza tries to drive on the up but makes no contact
on the middle and leg and is hit on the pad. Huge appeal but the umpire turns it down. He must have felt it might have missed the leg stump but Harris looks very disappointed

another appeal for a lbw. Again on that middle and leg and the umpire reckons it might have missed leg. Again close. Like the first appeal, it could have hit the leg, benefit of doubt goes to the batsman.
leans forward to turn it to the leg side
leans forward to ddrive to long-off for a single
on the leg stump, squeezed to square leg
beaten outside off stump. Probing line and length, just outside off and he pushes inside the line
cuts in from outside off, left alone but the ball kept coming in and went dangerously close to the off stump
on a length, on the stumps, pushed to covers
jumps from a length and he is beaten on the attempted dab to third man
slower one, full and outside off and he is beaten on the poke
beaten again.Some how he survives. A short of length delivery this time, he tried to run it down to third man
fullish, outside off, driven, partly steered, partly edged to third man
jabs a length delivery to third man. The throw from Albie almost takes out his skipper Smith standing at wide slip. Smiles all around. Not a good idea to hit your captain.
fuller and steered to point. Mortaza has been patient so far.
full in length, outside off, dabbed to third man
full and straight, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
attempts a yorker, falls short of the blockhole, driven to sweeper cover
leans forward to dab a length delivery to backward point
The ninth wicket is down. It was pretty short in length, outside the off stump and he top-edged a cut to the 'keeper
lands outside off and turns sharply, left alone.There is some big turn on offer, if only Bangladesh had made enough runs. Let's see what they can do with this total
similar delivery, left alone
on the off stump line, driven back to the bowler
leans forward to drive to long on
just outside off stump, left alone
fuller, driven to long-on for a single
fullish, on the off and middle, pushed to mid-off
edged but doesn't carry to de Villiers. Angled across the batsman who has a lame poke. Almost carried. Perhaps a better 'keeper would have got to it.
on a length, on the middle, tapped to the leg side
and again
length delivery on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
on a length, around off, dead-batted to the off side
outside off stump, late cut past backward point
leans forward to defend
comes down the track, drags back the length and he pushes it to covers
slows up the pace, floats it on the off stump, defended on the front foot
skips down the track and lofts inside-out to deep cover region
on the off stump line, defended solidly
flighted full, tickled to third man for couple of runs
huge appeal for a catch behind by de Villiers but its not given out. It was a loopy flighted delivery that spun past the outside edge
appeal for a lbw as he misses a sweep. Struck outside off
leans forward to defend
Bangladesh innings has been terminated. This time the batsman walks after nicking to de Villiers. Flighted around the off stump and edged behind

inn2.comm: probing deiivery to start the proceedings. It landed short of length, climbed and moved away as well. Gibbs was sucked into a forward prod and was beaten
full and swinging well outside off stump, Gibbs flashes it to backward point.
lovely leg cutter. It landed on a length, on the middle and cut away, Gibbs was squared up a touch but manages to push it to the off side
fuller, straighter, trying to trap him lbw and Gibbs manages to get his bat around the front pad and turn it past square leg. Mortaza thought he had his man there.
short in length, just outside off stump, defended on the front foot
full in length and in the zone outside off, left alone
pushed through quick outside off, left alone
goes back to turn it to midwicket
he walks to the off stump and clips it to fine leg
on the off stump, flatter, defended down the front foot
on the off stump line, steered to backward point
Gibbs begins the attack. He moved down the track, didn't reach the pitch of the ball but went through with his shot and heaved it to right of mid-on
rotates the strike with a single. The plan must be to have Gibbs attack.
moves down the wicket and flat-bats a slightly wide delivery over covers
on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
on a length, outside off stump, cut to wide third man
length delivery angling in towards hips, tucked behind square leg
length delivery, around the off and middle, jabbed to the leg side
shuffles outside off and swings it to deep square leg

caught at covers. It landed on the off and middle and turned away from Gibbs who  tried to force it off the back foot but hit it straight to covers. He was not in the right position and the ball turned a bit more than he thought.
fullish, on the middle and leg, turned behind square leg
flighted outside off, full, driven to mid-off
quicker, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
lets it turn in before wristing it to square leg
short in length and Peterson got quickly into position to pull it to deep square leg boundary
fuller and pushed towards mid-on
well outside off stump, Smith shuffles across and shoulders arms
again walks to the off stump, allows it to spin in towards middle before he wrists it  behind square leg
quicker, on the off stump line and defended on the front foot
loopy flighted delivery and Peterson takes it on the full and whips it through midwicket
arm-ball, on the middle, appeal for lbw as he stretched forward in defense. It hit the pad in front of middle and leg and looked pretty close.
on the middle and stump line, turned to the leg side
walks towards off, works it behind square leg for a single
on the middle stump line, nice loop there and defended on the front foot
just outside off and nudged away
slower, bit more air, full and defended to the off side
on the off stump line, dead batted away
on the legs, Peterson stayed back and worked it behind square leg
just outside off and pushed to the off side
a tad slow, turning away, pushed to covers
turn there. It landed full, on the middle and leg, he pushed at it and got a leading edge to the point
goes right back to defend
beaten. Tossed up, outside off stump, and spun past the edge
pushed through quicker, worked to right of midwicket
flighted outside off, a loose drive and he is beaten
struck on the pad outside off stump as he pushes forward to defend
gets in another armer, defended.
leans forward to defend
on the middle, again he plays it late and nudges to the on side
turns in from outside off, defended to the off side.
leans across to work a flighted delivery outside off to midwicket
quicker and Smith moves across to stab it to the off side
flighted one, driven to right of mid-on for a single
what a jaffa! Turn and bounce. It was ripped across quickly, landed on the middle and leg and turned Peterson inside out and went past the outside edge. Just a slip in, though.
shorter and worked to the on side
leans across to defend the turning delivery to the on side
top edges a sweep but it falls short of long leg fielder
huge turn again. This one starts from just outside off, though and Peterson lets it go past him
fuller, outside off, driven to covers
on the middle, turns towards off and middle, turned around the corner for a single
walks across, leans forward and turns a full delivery outside off, with the turn, to square leg
full and on the middle, turned to midwicket for a single.
turn and bounce and Smith withdraws his bat from the line and allows it to hit this thigh pad
fuller and Smith gets forward to defend
shuffles across and works it to midwicket
just outside off stump, nudged to the off side
turns in from outside off, taken on the pad
full and outside off stump, pushed to backward point
fullish, on the middle and defended on the front foot
on the middle and leg, pushed to the off side
full and on the middle and jabbed to the pad
leans forward to defend compactly to the off side
Super shot. Tossed up, around the off stump and he stretched forward to thread it inside-out to wide mid-off boundary
misses a sweep shot and is hit on the legs but well outside off stump. Too full for that shot.
walks across and works it with the turn to midwicket region
connects with the sweep shot this time and gets a single down to long leg
on the off and middle, defended to the on side
on the leg side, strikes the pad before running away towards short fine leg region
outside off stump, on a length, paddles to fine leg
flighted outside off, drives and gets a edge to left of backward point
moves outside off, tries to slog sweep but misses
slower in the air, outside off, nudged to the on side
inside-edges a jab to a delivery that turns in from outside off
Six over deep midwicket boundary. AGain, he walked outside off and swept it high and over.
goes back to punch a turning delivery to midwicket
A slight shuffle towards off and paddles a full delivery to fine leg
he leans forward to defend
floated full and paddled away from outside off to fine leg
lets it to turn in before wristing it to square leg
that shuffle outside off and he shapes to sweep, the bowler drags back the length and fires it quick, Smith doesn't connect and is struck on the pad outside off stump
beaten by the turn. It floated in from round the stumps, landed on off and middle before turning past the outside edge
leans forward to tap it to covers
and again. He has to pitch it slightly fuller
he does it and produces a edge but it doesn't carry to slip. Peterson is sucked into a forward prod and the ball took the edge and bisected Nafees and the 'keeper
shoulders arms to a turning delivery
outside off and is left alone. Drinks on the field.
on the legs, nudged to short fine leg
full and on the off stump, driven to mid-off
trapped in front. Quicker armer, on the middle stump line and it zipped off the track to strike him in front of the stumps.
slightly short in length, punched to sweeper cover
on the pads, turned behind square leg
again that walk to get outside the stumps and pushes to midwicket. By that movement, even if he is beaten by the turn, he will be struck outside off stump and can't be given out
leans forward to paddle sweep a full delivery on the middle for couple of runs
leans across to drive to cover point
comes down the track, doesn't reach the pitch and gets a inside-edge on the on drive and the ball runs through wide mid-on region
flat, quicker, punched to the bowler
slower and defended to the off side
gets outside off again and sweeps to long leg for a single
flat down the pads, Smith misses,Dhiman whips off the bails
flat, wide outside off, Smith gets across and misses the sweep
connects this sweep, but with a top-edge safely over midwicket
arm ball outside off, he opens the face and tries to run it fine
flat on off stump, whipped to midwicket
plants his leg outside the line and sweeps, but misses
flat on the stumps, he shuffles and drives to midwicket
full and flat, flicked from outside off to deep midwicket sweeper
bit of air, tries to sweep across the line but cant connect
wide outside off, he gets forward and leaves it alone
spins in from outside off, he gets back and works it to midwicket
flat on the pads, tucked into the gap at square leg
strides forward and flicks across the line to midwicket again
flat outside off, another trademark whip to midwicket
a touch shorter and he drives it back past de Villiers for one
drives off the front foot but is beaten by the flight
quicker one, he meets it with a huge stride forward
gets some width and cracks it out to deep cover sweeper
short again, he shuffles and punches to long-on for one more
slips on to the pads and Smith clips it to long leg region
poor delivery; Too short and it has been dispatched to midwicket boundary
from round the stumps this time, full and outside off, chopped to third man fro a single .
on the middle, tapped to the leg side
cuts in from just outside off, pushed to mid-on
stands tall to punch to mid-off
lands outside off, spins down leg, Smith shuffles across as his wont and turns it past square leg
just outside off stump, punched to cover region
stays back, waits for spin to play out before punching it past the bowler
floated full outside off, defended on the front foot
slightly short, arm ball but de Villiers pounces on the length to pull it over midwicket
again too short and de Villiers goes over mid-on this time. SA move to 96
well outside the off stump, really full and Smith pushes it tamely to point and is livid with himself for playing a soft shot
outside off, left alone
leans forward to whip with the turn to long-on
quickish spin, full but de Villiers stays back to jab it to the on side
on the middle and leg, turned behind square leg
flighted full and driven to mid-off
from round the stumps, on the middle and off, whipped to midwicket
on the leg and middle, clipped past square leg for couple of runs
length delivery on the off stump, pushed to mid-off
length delivery, coming in a touch and Smith fists it on the up to long on
full pitched outside off, driven to covers
Really nice shot. fullish, outside off stump and de Villiers plays a lovely square drive past point. He just bent his knee a touch to get in right balance.
shuffles across again, gets outside line of off stump and works to the on side
turns in from outside off stump , worked past square leg
floated on the middle and off, driven to covers
fuller, quicker and de Villiers takes care not to press his front foot across and drivs down the track
Shot! slightly short and turning away from de Villiers who cracks it past the diving backward point fielder. He looks in great nick.
full pitched, around off stump, mistimes a drive to covers
moves to 49 with a slice over backward point and down to wide third man
on a length, around middle and off, gets a inside-edge on the off drive
full pitched, on the  off stump, driven to covers
walks forward and across, gets outside off, takes it on the full and picks it over midwicket
walks outside off and works it to midwicket
flighted full, on driven to midwicket
tossed outside off, turns in , worked to midwicket
That's his 36th ODI fifty with a drill through extra cover. It was tossed up, he reached out and drove against the turn.
pushed back to the bowler
unfurls a slog sweep from outside off stump
short in length, on the stumps, punched to right of mid-on
full pitched outside off stump, de Villiers knives it through extra cover. Fab shot.
Even better. Super shot this. He stood up tall and fisted a short-of-length delivery on the up and to the left of mid-off.
on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
leans forward to drive to covers
overpitched and he mistimes a drive to covers
turns in from outside off, dabbed to fine leg
turned sharply from middle and leg, de Villiers was shaping to pull but adjusts to punch it to covers
goes back to force a length delivery to sweeper cover
slog sweep over midwicket. They are finishing it in a hurry. Off he went outside off stump, went down on his knee and fetched it from outside off and sent it soaring over the boundary.
shapes in from outside off, defended on the front foot

done in by the nip-backer. It cut in from outside off stump, the bat came down outside the line and it hit the pad in front of middle and went on to disturb the furniture. He would have been out lbw even if it didn't go on to hit the stumps. But a refreshing innings from de Villiers. He came in and immediately upped the ante.
on the off and middle, nudged to the on side
just outside off stump, defended to the off side
stays back to punch it to mid-on
leans forward to drive to extra cover
spins down the leg side and Dhiman can't gather it
walks to the off stump and on drives to midwicket
Sweeps the series with a six. Emphatic win. He went down the track, getting outside off in the process and lofted it over long-on. With that South Africa move to no 1 position in the ODI rankings.
